black_pepper.name: Black Pepper
black_pepper.description: Black Pepper is a spice made from the dried fruit of the pepper plant. It is used to add flavor to food. It is also used as a medicine.

celery.name: Celery
celery.description: Celery is a plant. The stalks are used to make medicine.

celery_seed.name: Celery Seed
celery_seed.description: Celery seed is a spice made from the dried seeds of the celery plant. It is used to add flavor to food. It is also used as a medicine.

egg.name: Egg
egg.description: Egg is a food made from the egg of a bird. It is used to make many foods and medicines.

green_onion.name: Green Onion
green_onion.description: Green onion is a plant. The leaves and bulb are used to make medicine.

ground_pepper.name: Ground Pepper
ground_pepper.description: Ground pepper is a spice made from the dried fruit of the pepper plant. It is used to add flavor to food. It is also used as a medicine.

potato.name: Potato
potato.description: Potato is a plant. The tuber is used to make medicine.

salt.name: Salt
salt.description: Salt is a mineral. It is used to add flavor to food. It is also used as a medicine.

white_pepper.name: White Pepper
white_pepper.description: White pepper is a spice made from the dried fruit of the pepper plant. It is used to add flavor to food. It is also used as a medicine.

white_vinegar.name: White Vinegar
white_vinegar.description: White vinegar is a liquid made from fermented alcohol. It is used to add flavor to food. It is also used as a medicine.

yellow_mustard.name: Yellow Mustard
yellow_mustard.description: Yellow mustard is a spice made from the seeds of the mustard plant. It is used to add flavor to food. It is also used as a medicine.

banana.name: Banana
banana.description: A banana is an elongated, edible fruit – botanically a berry – produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa.

flour.name: Flour
flour.description: Flour is a powder made by grinding raw grains, roots, beans, nuts, or seeds. Flours are used to make many different foods.

canola_oil.name: Canola Oil
canola_oil.description: Canola oil is a food-grade version derived from rapeseed cultivars bred for low erucic acid content

buttermilk.name: Buttermilk
buttermilk.description: Buttermilk is a fermented dairy drink. Traditionally, it was the liquid left behind after churning butter out of cultured cream.

vanilla_extract.name: Vanilla Extract
vanilla_extract.description: Vanilla extract is a solution made by macerating and percolating vanilla pods in a solution of ethanol and water.

walnut.name: Walnut
walnut.description: A walnut is the edible seed of any tree of the genus Juglans (family Juglandaceae), particularly the Persian or English walnut, Juglans regia.

butter.name: Butter
butter.description: Butter is a dairy product made from the fat and protein components of churned cream. It is a semi-solid emulsion at room temperature, consisting of approximately 80% butterfat.

sugar.name: Sugar
sugar.description: Sugar is the generic name for sweet-tasting, soluble carbohydrates, many of which are used in food. Simple sugars, also called monosaccharides, include glucose, fructose, and galactose.

sour_cream.name: Sour Cream
sour_cream.description: Sour cream is a dairy product obtained by fermenting regular cream with certain kinds of lactic acid bacteria.

muffin_mix.name: Muffin Mix
muffin_mix.description: The soft and moist texture of the batter coupled with the pleasant vanilla flavour allows you to create extremely delicious and rich treats.

milk.name: Milk
milk.description: Milk is a white liquid food produced by the mammary glands of mammals.

corn.name: Corn
corn.description: Corn is a cereal grain first domesticated by indigenous peoples in southern Mexico about 10,000 years ago.

bacon.name: Bacon
bacon.description: Bacon is a type of salt-cured pork made from various cuts, typically the belly or less fatty parts of the back.

carrot.name: Carrot
carrot.description: The carrot is a root vegetable, typically orange in color, though purple, black, red, white, and yellow cultivars exist,all of which are domesticated forms of the wild carrot, Daucus carota, native to Europe and Southwestern Asia.

onion.name: Onion
onion.description: An onion is a vegetable that is the most widely cultivated species of the genus Allium.

parsley.name: Parsley
parsley.description: Parsley is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae that is native to Greece, Morocco and the former Yugoslavia.

broth.name: Broth
broth.description: Broth, also known as bouillon is a savory liquid made of water in which meat, fish or vegetables have been simmered for a short period of time.

baking_powder.name: Baking Powder
baking_powder.description: Baking powder is a dry chemical leavening agent, a mixture of a carbonate or bicarbonate and a weak acid. The base and acid are prevented from reacting prematurely by the inclusion of a buffer such as cornstarch.

chicken.name: Chicken
chicken.description: Chicken is the most common type of poultry in the world. Owing to the relative ease and low cost of raising chickens—in comparison to mammals such as cattle or hogs—chicken meat and chicken eggs have become prevalent in numerous cuisines.

lemon_pepper.name: Lemon Pepper
lemon_pepper.description: Lemon pepper (also called lemon pepper seasoning) is a seasoning made from granulated lemon zest and cracked black peppercorns.[

brown_sugar.name: Brown Sugar
brown_sugar.description: Brown sugar is a sucrose sugar product with a distinctive brown color due to the presence of molasses.

monterey_jack_cheese.name: Monterey Jack Cheese
monterey_jack_cheese.description: Monterey Jack, sometimes shortened to Jack, is a US white, semi-hard cheese made using cow's milk, with a mild flavor and slight sweetness.

blueberry.name: Blueberry
blueberry.description: Blueberries are a widely distributed and widespread group of perennial flowering plants with blue or purple berries.

nut.name: Nut
nut.description: A nut is a fruit consisting of a hard or tough nutshell protecting a kernel which is usually edible. In general usage and in a culinary sense, a wide variety of dry seeds are called nuts, but in a botanical context `nut` implies that the shell does not open to release the seed

molasses.name: Molasses
molasses.description: Molasses is a viscous substance resulting from refining sugarcane or sugar beets into sugar.

ginger.name: Ginger
ginger.description: Ginger is a flowering plant whose rhizome, ginger root or ginger, is widely used as a spice and a folk medicine.

cinnamon.name: Cinnamon
cinnamon.description: Cinnamon is a spice obtained from the inner bark of several tree species from the genus Cinnamomum. Cinnamon is used mainly as an aromatic condiment and flavouring additive in a wide variety of cuisines, sweet and savoury dishes, breakfast cereals, snack foods, bagels, teas, hot chocolate and traditional foods.

chocolate_chip.name: Chocolate Chip
chocolate_chip.description: Chocolate chips or chocolate morsels are small chunks of sweetened chocolate, used as an ingredient in a number of desserts (notably chocolate chip cookies and muffins), in trail mix and less commonly in some breakfast foods such as pancakes.

butterscotch_chip.name: Butterscotch Chip
butterscotch_chip.description: Butterscotch is a type of confectionery whose primary ingredients are brown sugar and butter. Some recipes include corn syrup, cream, vanilla, and salt.

peanut_butter.name: Peanut Butter
peanut_butter.description: Peanut butter is a food paste or spread made from ground, dry-roasted peanuts. It commonly contains additional ingredients that modify the taste or texture, such as salt, sweeteners, or emulsifiers.

peanut.name: Peanut
peanut.description: The peanut is a legume crop grown mainly for its edible seeds.

caramel.name: Caramel
caramel.description: Caramel is an orange-brown confectionery product made by heating a range of sugars. It can be used as a flavoring in puddings and desserts, as a filling in bonbons, or as a topping for ice cream and custard.

whipping_cream.name: Whipping Cream
whipping_cream.description: Whipping cream is heavy cream, double cream, or other high-fat cream, that is whipped by a whisk or mixer until it is light and fluffy and holds its shape, or by the expansion of dissolved gas, forming a firm colloid.

enchilada_sauce.name: Enchilada Sauce
enchilada_sauce.description: Enchilada sauce includes chili-based sauces, such as salsa roja, various moles, tomatillo-based sauces, such as salsa verde, or cheese-based sauces, such as chile con queso.

cream_cheese.name: Cream Cheese
cream_cheese.description: Cream cheese is a soft, usually mild-tasting fresh cheese made from milk and cream.

salsa.name: Salsa
salsa.description: Salsa is a variety of sauces used as condiments for tacos and other Mexican and Mexican-American foods, and as dips for tortilla chips.

bean.name: Bean
bean.description: A bean is the seed of several plants in the family Fabaceae, which are used as vegetables for human or animal food. They can be cooked in many different ways, including boiling, frying, and baking, and are used in many traditional dishes throughout the world.

tortilla.name: Tortilla
tortilla.description: A tortilla  is a thin, circular unleavened flatbread from Mexico and Central America originally made from maize hominy meal, and now also from wheat flour.

lettuce.name: Lettuce
lettuce.description: Lettuce is an annual plant of the family Asteraceae. It is most often grown as a leaf vegetable, but sometimes for its stem and seeds. Lettuce is most often used for salads, although it is also seen in other kinds of food, such as soups, sandwiches and wraps; it can also be grilled.

bread_crust.name: Bread Crust
bread_crust.description: Bread crust is formed from surface dough during the cooking process. It is hardened and browned through the Maillard reaction using the sugars and amino acids due to the intense heat at the bread surface.

honey.name: Honey
honey.description: Honey is a sweet and viscous substance made by several bees, the best-known of which are honey bees.

corn_starch.name: Corn Starch
corn_starch.description: Corn starch is the starch derived from corn grain.

tilapia.name: Tilapia
tilapia.description: Tilapia is the common name for nearly a hundred species of cichlid fish from the coelotilapine, coptodonine, heterotilapine, oreochromine, pelmatolapiine, and tilapiine tribes (formerly all were 'Tilapiini'), with the economically most important species placed in the Coptodonini and Oreochromini.

lemon.name: Lemon
lemon.description: The lemon (Citrus limon) is a species of small evergreen trees in the flowering plant family Rutaceae, native to Asia, primarily Northeast India (Assam), Northern Myanmar or China.

garlic.name: Garlic
garlic.description: Garlic (Allium sativum) is a species of bulbous flowering plant in the genus Allium. Its close relatives include the onion, shallot, leek, chive, Welsh onion and Chinese onion.

caper.name: Caper
caper.description: The salted and pickled caper bud (called simply a caper) is used as an ingredient, seasoning, or garnish. Capers are a common ingredient in Mediterranean cuisine, especially Cypriot, Italian, Aeolian Greek, and Maltese food.

oregano.name: Oregano
oregano.description: Oregano is a culinary herb, used for the flavour of its leaves, which can be more intense when dried than fresh. It has an earthy, warm, and slightly bitter taste, which can vary in intensity.

paprika.name: Paprika
paprika.description: Paprika is a spice made from dried and ground red peppers.

ground_beef.name: Ground Beef
ground_beef.description: Ground beef, minced beef or beef mince is beef that has been finely chopped with a knife, meat grinder.

basil.name: Basil
basil.description: Basil is most commonly used fresh in recipes. In general, it is added last, as cooking quickly destroys the flavor. The fresh herb can be kept for a short time in plastic bags in the refrigerator, or for a longer period in the freezer, after being blanched quickly in boiling water.

cherry_pie_filling.name: Cherry Pie Filling
cherry_pie_filling.description: Cherry pie filling is sweet, tart & ready in 10 minutes! Made with sweet or sour cherries & thickened with cornstarch until glossy.

macaroni.name: Macaroni
macaroni.description: Macaroni is dry pasta shaped like narrow tubes. Made with durum wheat, macaroni is commonly cut in short lengths; curved macaroni may be referred to as elbow macaroni.

cheese.name: Cheese
cheese.description: Cheese is a dairy product produced in wide ranges of flavors, textures, and forms by coagulation of the milk protein casein.

cheddar_cheese.name: Cheddar Cheese
cheddar_cheese.description: Cheddar cheese (or simply cheddar) is a natural cheese that is relatively hard, off-white (or orange if colourings such as annatto are added), and sometimes sharp-tasting.

dough.name: Dough
dough.description: Dough is a thick, malleable, sometimes elastic paste made from grains or from leguminous or chestnut crops. Dough is typically made by mixing flour with a small amount of water or other liquid and sometimes includes yeast or other leavening agents, as well as ingredients such as fats or flavorings.

nutmeg.name: Nutmeg
nutmeg.description: Nutmeg is the seed, or the ground spice derived from that seed, of several tree species of the genus Myristica.

apple.name: Apple
apple.description: An apple is an edible fruit produced by an apple tree.

egg_white.name: Egg White
egg_white.description: Egg white is the clear liquid (also called the albumen or the glair/glaire) contained within an egg.

pork_sausage.name: Pork Sausage
pork_sausage.description: A sausage is a type of meat product usually made from ground meat—often pork, beef, or poultry—along with salt, spices and other flavourings.

tomato_sauce.name: Tomato Sauce
tomato_sauce.description: Tomato sauce (also known as salsa roja in Spanish or salsa di pomodoro in Italian) can refer to many different sauces made primarily from tomatoes, usually to be served as part of a dish, rather than as a condiment.

cottage_cheese.name: Cottage Cheese
cottage_cheese.description: Cottage cheese is a curdled milk product with a mild flavor and a creamy, heterogenous, soupy texture. It is made from skimmed milk by draining curds, but retaining some of the whey and keeping the curds loose.

ricotta_cheese.name: Ricotta Cheese
ricotta_cheese.description: Ricotta is an Italian whey cheese made from sheep, cow, goat, or Italian water buffalo milk whey left over from the production of other cheeses.

noodles.name: Noodles
noodles.description: Noodles are a type of food made from unleavened dough which is either rolled flat and cut, stretched, or extruded, into long strips or strings.

dry_yeast.name: Dry Yeast
dry_yeast.description: Dry yeast is a dehydrated form of baker's yeast. The dehydration process drastically extends its shelf-life and creates a product that no longer requires refrigeration.

water.name: Water
water.description: Water is an inorganic compound with the chemical formula H2O.

bread_flour.name: Bread Flour
bread_flour.description: Bread flour is typically made from red hard wheat planted in the fall and harvested in the spring (winter wheat).

green_pepper.name: Green Pepper
green_pepper.description: The bell pepper (also known as paprika, sweet pepper, pepper, or capsicum) is the fruit of plants in the Grossum Group of the species Capsicum annuum.

red_pepper.name: Red Pepper
red_pepper.description: The bell pepper (also known as paprika, sweet pepper, pepper, or capsicum) is the fruit of plants in the Grossum Group of the species Capsicum annuum.

yellow_pepper.name: Yellow Pepper
yellow_pepper.description: The bell pepper (also known as paprika, sweet pepper, pepper, or capsicum) is the fruit of plants in the Grossum Group of the species Capsicum annuum.

mushroom.name: Mushroom
mushroom.description: Edible mushrooms are the fleshy and edible fruit bodies of several species of macrofungi (fungi which bear fruiting structures that are large enough to be seen with the naked eye).

olive.name: Olive
olive.description: The olive, botanical name Olea europaea, meaning 'European olive' in Latin, is a species of small tree or shrub in the family Oleaceae, found traditionally in the Mediterranean Basin.

spaghetti.name: Spaghetti
spaghetti.description: Spaghetti is a long, thin, solid, cylindrical pasta. It is a staple food of traditional Italian cuisine.

parmesan_cheese.name: Parmesan Cheese
parmesan_cheese.description: Parmesan is an Italian hard, granular cheese produced from cows' milk and aged at least 12 months.

shrimp.name: Shrimp
shrimp.description: Shrimp are crustaceans (a form of shellfish) with elongated bodies and a primarily swimming mode of locomotion.

rice.name: Rice
rice.description: Rice is the seed of the grass species Oryza sativa (Asian rice) or less commonly O. glaberrima (African rice).

powdered_sugar.name: Powdered Sugar
powdered_sugar.description: Powdered sugar, also called confectioners' sugar, or icing sugar, is a finely ground sugar produced by milling granulated sugar into a powdered state.

peanut_butter_cup.name: Peanut Butter Cup
peanut_butter_cup.description: A peanut butter cup is a molded chocolate with a peanut butter filling. Peanut butter cups are one of the most popular kinds of candy in America.

chocolate_fudge.name: Chocolate Fudge
chocolate_fudge.description: Fudge is a type of confection that is made by mixing sugar, butter and milk.

angel_pasta.name: Angel Pasta
angel_pasta.description: Variant of pasta: very thin and delicate strands of pasta

watermelon.name: Watermelon
watermelon.description: Watermelon is a flowering plant species of the Cucurbitaceae family and the name of its edible fruit.

vodka.name: Vodka
vodka.description: Vodka is a clear distilled alcoholic beverage.

lemon_juice.name: Lemon Juice
lemon_juice.description: Lemon juice is used to make lemonade, soft drinks, and cocktails.

eggplant.name: Eggplant
eggplant.description: Eggplant is a plant species in the nightshade family Solanaceae. Solanum melongena is grown worldwide for its edible fruit.

olive_oil.name: Olive Oil
olive_oil.description: Olive oil is a liquid fat obtained by pressing whole olives, the fruit of Olea europaea, a traditional tree crop of the Mediterranean Basin, and extracting the oil.

fettuccine.name: Fettuccine
fettuccine.description: Fettuccine is a type of pasta popular in Roman and Tuscan cuisine. It is descended from the extremely thin capelli d'angelo of the Renaissance but is a flat, thick pasta traditionally made of egg and flour.

steak.name: Steak
steak.description: A steak is a thick cut of meat generally sliced across the muscle fibers, sometimes including a bone. It is normally grilled or fried. Steak can be diced, cooked in sauce, such as in steak and kidney pie, or minced and formed into patties, such as hamburgers.

soy_sauce.name: Soy Sauce
soy_sauce.description: Soy sauce is a liquid condiment of Chinese origin, traditionally made from a fermented paste of soybeans, roasted grain, brine, and Aspergillus oryzae or Aspergillus sojae molds. It is considered to contain a strong umami taste.

cabbage.name: Cabbage
cabbage.description: Cabbage, comprising several cultivars of Brassica oleracea, is a leafy green, red (purple), or white (pale green) biennial plant grown as an annual vegetable crop for its dense-leaved heads.

fish_sauce.name: Fish Sauce
fish_sauce.description: Fish sauce is a liquid condiment made from fish or krill that have been coated in salt and fermented for up to two years.
